solution_line_template: First, you have to add the number of students that liked the three other fruits. Therefore, you have to add {students_liked_oranges} + {students_liked_pears} + {students_liked_apples}. This gives you a sum of {sum_other_fruits}.

We know that {total_students_interviewed} students were interviewed, so you have to subtract {sum_other_fruits} from {total_students_interviewed} to get the number of students who liked strawberries. {total_students_interviewed} - {sum_other_fruits} = <<{total_students_interviewed}-{sum_other_fruits}={students_liked_strawberries}>>{students_liked_strawberries} students liked strawberries best out of all of the fruits.
